AI won't kill creativity‚Äîbut it is rewriting the rules. The role of today‚Äôs marketing leader has expanded well beyond traditional boundaries. To lead effectively in this landscape, marketing executives must embody a multidimensional skill set: combining strategic vision, technological fluency, and emotional intelligence. - Meet elevated consumer expectations & balance the dual mandate short term business and long term equity
- Foster teams grounded in a growth mindset, equipping them to stay agile, focused, and optimistic

The Power Play Combo of Sports + Brands
column4: What happens when elite athletes and visionary marketers team up? In this dynamic conversation, Draymond Green (Golden State Warriors), Aaron Gordon (Denver Nuggets), and Virgil van Dijk (Liverpool FC) join Paulie Dery, CMO of AG1, for a conversation moderated by Fara Leff, COO of Klutch Sports Group. With AG1's role in the wellness space as a backdrop, the session offers a candid look at how athletes maintain performance, build their brands, and expand their reach across industries. Whether it's a product, a platform, or a personal mission‚Äîthis is where sports and brand strategy collide.

column3: Proof of Performance: The Power of Premium Video in Driving Measurable, Sustainable Business Results

For decades, TV‚Äînow shorthand for all the platforms delivering premium video content‚Äîhas been the effective centerpiece of advertisers‚Äô media strategies. But in the social era of ‚Äúlast click‚Äù attribution and instant reporting, TV doesn‚Äôt always get the credit it deserves for influencing action and driving sales.
In 2025, that‚Äôs changing. Thanks to advanced data and new technologies, it‚Äôs now possible (and illuminating!) to measure TV‚Äôs proof of performance throughout the purchase funnel. What are we saying? It‚Äôs Simple: Premium Video Performs.

column3: Rules of the Road: Best Practices for Breakthrough Creative
column4:
What makes creative actually land ‚Äì not just in the room, but in the real world where audiences are distracted, impatient and on the move? Too often, campaigns are built for polished presentations or idealised environments, not the chaotic, context-rich spaces where people actually encounter them.
This panel unpacks the creative principles that break through in 2025. Drawing on new research into what makes ads memorable, engaging and effective on Uber - including what led 65% of users to discover a new brand because it was advertised on Uber.
Speakers: Mrinalini Nair, Head of Ads Industry Marketing, Uber ; Natalie Lacey, Executive Vice President, National Research Group; Karen Martin, CEO, BBH; Ben Sherburn, Head of Marketing - Food & Beverages, McDonalds& Gemma Charles, Deputy Editor of Campaign UK (Moderator)

column3: PRESENTED BY Teads - The Values Multiplier: Where Brand Meets Performance
column4:
For years, marketers have wrestled with the tension between long-term brand equity and short-term performance ‚Äî often forced to choose between building trust and driving conversions.

In this provocative session, agency and brand leaders will explore how shared values can serve as the bridge between both worlds. We‚Äôll examine how purpose-led storytelling, when paired with smart targeting and data-driven execution, can drive results now and build lasting loyalty.

Through real-world examples and candid conversation, we‚Äôll challenge the traditional trade-off narrative ‚Äî and reveal how leading marketers are using values as a powerful lever to fuel both immediate performance and sustained brand growth.

column3: Building a durable brand in the AI era
column4:
The performance-marketing era is ending. As AI reduces barriers to entry, competitive advantages rooted solely in performance advertising are disappearing. The only lasting advantage is a durable brand built on authenticity, trust, and meaningful consumer relationships. Durable brands weather disruptions and maintain loyalty. They show up time and again, with consistency, clarity, and focus. This session will share how to build a durable brand and why brands need to optimize around tech, creativity, and media to drive outsized impact. column4:
In this behind-the-scenes fireside chat hosted by Digiday, Sainsbury‚Äôs and DEPT¬Æ unpack how they‚Äôve embedded AI agents into the core of Nectar360, Sainsbury‚Äôs retail media business. With over 100 campaigns and thousands of assets to manage each year, the team needed a faster, smarter way to handle asset compliance without compromising on quality. Their solution? A custom-built, multi-agent AI system that reviews logos, fonts, colors, objects, positioning, and T&Cs across static and video assets in under 20 seconds, with more than 90% accuracy. Unveiled by Sainsbury‚Äôs at Cannes, the platform is already reducing errors, cutting costs, and freeing up time for teams to focus on strategy and creativity. Join us to explore how AI agents are powering real change in retail media and why starting with practical, scalable solutions like this is the smartest way to move forward.

column3: PRESENTED BY QRU - "Football is for Food" - How Uber Eats Transformed NFL Marketing All Season Long
column4: Join us for a fireside chat featuring Georgie Jeffreys, Head of Marketing at Uber and Uber Eats for North America, and Kelsey Hodgkin, CEO and Partner of Special US, as they discuss the award-winning "Football is for Food" campaign. This season-long initiative spun an intricate web between Uber Eats, the NFL and all the unexpected food references hidden within the game, to create one of the funniest, and *dumbest* conspiracies of the year. Together, we will discuss the unique cultural insights that sparked the inventive campaign, revealing how the convergence of football and food references opened new avenues for both engagement and sales, and culminated in a unique crescendo for the brand at Super Bowl LIX. With humor at its core, the campaign turned what could have been a clever retail ecosystem into a fully integrated brand idea, that kept viewers engaged with both the brand and the app through the season.

column3: From ID to AI: Rethinking identity through intelligence, not just identifiers
column4: As the digital ad ecosystem moves beyond cookies and identifiers, marketers face a new reality: fragmented signals, shifting standards, and measurement blind spots. At the same time, AI is transitioning from headline concept into practical advantage, enabling powerful efficiencies for advertisers that can protect against these headwinds. This panel explores how location intelligence‚Äîsupercharged by AI‚Äîoffers a more resilient alternative that goes beyond IDs: one that unites physical and digital behavior to build richer, more dynamic audiences. This results in smarter, more intent-based campaigns that adapt across environments, whether IDs are present or not. We‚Äôll unpack how this shift enables unified audience planning, cross-screen optimization, and real-world measurement to better reflect how people actually live and predict future behavior. It‚Äôs a bold, forward-thinking conversation on identity and AI‚Äîwithout the identity crisis.

column3:
Reigniting IP: 
How Gap Inc. Got Its Vibe Back
column4:
After years of instability at Gap Inc., Richard Dickson's 2023 CEO appointment has prompted a steady improvement in sales, market share and customer sentiment by leveraging the brand reinvigoration playbook. Fresh from masterminding the Barbie phenomenon and IP reinvigoration, Dickson's made the Gap Inc. portfolio a case study in how investing in brand storytelling and customer-centric creativity, while relying on data, is the key to marketing and business success.
This co-presentation will exhibit the power of reinvesting in brand to reignite dormant IP and how to evaluate and unlock big ideas using data.
By drawing on their shared experiences, Dickson and MediaLink's Andrea Kerr Redniss will give practical insights for executing successful brand transformation that drives relevance, revenue and opportunity.

Andrea Kerr Redniss, Managing Director, MediaLink & Partner, UTA & Richard Dickson, President & CEO,. Gap Inc.

column3:
Culture Briefing:

Building Cultural Resonance
for the World Cup
column4: Too often, brands confuse culture with fleeting moments. Culture means people‚Äîshared language, rituals, and identity built over time. When the 2026 FIFA World Cup comes to North America, the world‚Äôs football tribes will converge with the unique cultures of US soccer fandom‚Äîcultures formed long before the 39-day tournament. TMA and Dieste, empowered by Omnicom, explore how brands can create true cultural resonance on this massive, extended platform. With soccer fandom shaped by multicultural roots and layered loyalties, this session reveals how to craft communications that move people‚Äîand deliver impact beyond the final whistle.‚Äã

column3: Facts over fakes: Why the open internet matters
column4: The digital advertising market is increasingly controlled a few powerful tech giants. As a result, advertisers are losing transparency, data sovereignty, and direct access to their audiences‚Äîas well as control over the environments in which their brands appear. Despite this growing dependency, many brands continue to focus on these closed ecosystems, often due to a lack of scalable alternatives. Yet there is an alternative: the open internet. Our panel brings together leaders who understand the essential role of premium, trustworthy environments in today's digital advertising: advertiser, agencies, publisher, tech provider and T-Ads.
